result.execSummary:
The defendant Gecoby L Glosson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Court grants 5 days credit, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
$250.00 BAIL APPLIED. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation along with Case 15TR4841.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with the victim, Mark P. as listed in the complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Any other condition deemed appropriate by the Agent.
Not to operate a MV unless properly licensed.
COURT ORDERS FORFEITURE OF WEAPON USED IN THE CRIME.
Possession of weapons to be approved by Agent.
Cases 15TR4842 and 15TR4843 were dismissed and read into: 15CM1552. 15TR4841 to be paid along with this case on Probation.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Gecoby L Glosson in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts #1 and #3 are dismissed and read into Count #2.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   
9 MONTHS JAIL, (APPLY 5 DAYS CREDIT - IF REVOKED);


TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR(S); (probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*No contact with:  Victim Mark P. as listed in criminal complaint. 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Any other condition deemed appropriate by agent. 
*Perform 75 Hours Community Service.
*Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. 
*Possession of weapons to be approved by agent.

OTHER: COURT ORDERS FORFEITURE OF WEAPON USED IN CRIME. 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (APPLY CASH BAIL);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of probation);
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 10:30 am

Apply $250.00 cash previously posted.   $400.00 Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to Defendant's mother.  COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND PREVIOUSLY SIGNED BY THE DEFENDANT AND A $1000.00 SURETY BOND TO BE CO-SIGNED BY THE DEFENDANT'S MOTHER.  Defendant to have no contact with Mark P. as listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.

Defendant to have no contact with Mark P. as listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  BOND TO BE COSIGNED BY THE DEFENDANT'S MOTHER.
THIS BOND IS IN ADDITION TO THE $250.00 CASH BOND AND $1000.00 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant Gecoby L Glosson in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers advises the Court the parties are close to reaching a resolution and requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing.  Attorney Weathers requests $400.00 of the cash bail be returned to the Defendant's mother.   The Court orders that $400.00 of the cash bail be returned to the Defendant's mother. The Court sets a surety bond in the amount of $1000.00 to be co-signed by the Defendant's mother.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Hearing at 01-20-2016 11:00 am

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Gecoby L Glosson did not appear.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Weathers has received discovery and a criminal complaint is provided in court.  Attorney Weathers is still waiting for an offer.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing at 12-02-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Gecoby L Glosson in court.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has not retained counsel yet.   The Court orders the Defendant to apply at the public defender's office and return back to Court.  The Courtr recalls the case with the same appearances.  The Defendant does qualify for represenation and an attorney will be appointed.
